page.title: 03TRADE - Cattle Market
page.content: The{Alford Stock market}is held every {Tuesday in East Street.}The market opens at 11.15 am by a man ringing a bell. The auctioneers are{Wilsons.}On the 25th of June there were 36 lambs and 7 bullocks for sale. The bullocks are first weighed on some huge scales and then sold by the kilogram. The average weight was 450kg. They were sold for 92 pence per kg. Next the auctioneer moved to the lambs. They were in pens of 4 or 5 and sold for between Â£27 and Â£29. The buyers for the bullocks and lambs were all butchers,{Kelsey}from{Tetford, Holmes from{Burgh-le-Marsh}and a butcher from {Hogsthorpe.}The market is much guieter now, only about a sixth of the pens were full.{A special fat stock market {is held in December each year.
